$description: Core focus ring primitives for keyboard navigation accessibility. Focus indicators are CRITICAL for accessibility - they show keyboard users which element is active. WCAG 2.4.7 requires visible focus indicators. RULE: Never remove focus styles without providing an alternative. Use :focus-visible for keyboard-only focus.

focus.$description: Focus ring configuration for consistent, accessible focus indicators across all interactive elements.

ring.$description: Focus ring appearance. Uses outline (not border) to avoid layout shifts. Combines width, offset, and color for visibility against any background.

width.$description: Focus ring width (3px). Thick enough to be clearly visible per WCAG 2.4.11 (Focus Appearance). Use for: outline-width property. 3px provides clear visibility without being obtrusive. Consistent across all focusable elements.

offset.$description: Focus ring offset from element (2px). Creates gap between element and focus ring for clarity. Use for: outline-offset property. Prevents focus ring from overlapping element borders. Ensures ring is visible on both light and dark backgrounds.

color.$description: Focus ring color (primary blue). High-visibility color that works on most backgrounds. Reference to color.blue.5 for consistency with primary brand color. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure 3:1 contrast ratio against adjacent colors. May need adjustment for dark theme.
